snippet.title: Complex organic molecules in protoplanetary disks
snippet.description: Complex organic molecules in protoplanetary disks / Walsh, Catherine (Leiden Observatory, The Netherlands ; School of Mathematics and Physics, Queen's University Belfast, UK) ; Millar, T J (School of Mathematics and Physics, Queen's University Belfast, UK) ; Nomura, Hideko (Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences, Tokyo Institute of Technology, Japan) ; Herbst, Eric (Departments of Chemistry, Astronomy, and Physics, University of Virginia, USA) ; Weaver, Susanna L Widicus (Department of Chemistry, Emory University, USA) ; Aikawa, Yuri (Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences, Kobe University, Japan) ; Laas, Jake C (Department of Chemistry, Emory University, USA) ; Vasyunin, Anton I (Department of Chemistry, University of Virginia, USA) (Abridged) Protoplanetary disks are vital objects in star and planet formation, possessing all the material which may form a planetary system orbiting the new star. We investigate the synthesis of complex organic molecules (COMs) in disks to constrain the achievable chemical complexity and predict species and transitions which may be observable with ALMA. [...] arXiv:1403.0390.- 2014 - 34 p. \- Published in : Walsh et al. 2014, A&A, 536, A33 (available here: http://www.aanda.org/articles/aa/abs/2014/03/aa22446-13/aa22446-13.html) External link: Preprint

snippet.title: Physical and chemical structure of planet-forming disks probed by millimeter observations and modeling
snippet.description: Physical and chemical structure of planet-forming disks probed by millimeter observations and modeling / Dutrey, Anne (- Laboratoire d'Astrophysique de Bordeaux, CNRS, University of Bordeaux, France) ; Semenov, Dmitry (- Max-Planck-Institut für Astronomie, Königstuhl, Heidelberg, Germany) ; Chapillon, Edwige (- Institute of Astronomy and Astrophysics, Academia Sinica, Taiwan, Republic of China) ; Gorti, Uma (- SETI Institute, 189 Bernardo Ave, Mountain View USA - NASA Ames Research Center, USA) ; Guilloteau, Stéphane (- Laboratoire d'Astrophysique de Bordeaux, CNRS, University of Bordeaux, France) ; Hersant, Franck (- Laboratoire d'Astrophysique de Bordeaux, CNRS, University of Bordeaux, France) ; Hogerheijde, Michiel (- Leiden Observatory, Leiden University, The Netherlands) ; Hughes, Meredith (- Wesleyan University, Department of Astronomy, Van Vleck Observatory, USA) ; Meeus, Gwendolyn (- UAM, Dpto. Fisica Teurica, Mud.15, Fac. de Ciencias, Madrid, Spain) ; Nomura, Hideko (- Department of Astronomy, Graduate School of Science, Kyoto University, Japan) et al. Protoplanetary disks composed of dust and gas are ubiquitous around young stars and are commonly recognized as nurseries of planetary systems. [...] arXiv:1402.3503. \- 2014\. - 24 p. Preprint

EVOLVE : International Conference \- A Bridge between Probability, Set Oriented Numerics, and Evolutionary Computation IV 10 - 13 Jul 2013 \- Leiden, Netherlands / Emmerich, Michael (ed.); Deutz, Andre (ed.); Schuetze, Oliver (ed.); Bäck, Thomas (ed.); Tantar, Emilia (ed.); Tantar, Alexandru-Adrian (ed.); Moral, Pierre (ed.); Legrand, Pierrick (ed.); Bouvry, Pascal (ed.); Coello, Carlos (ed.) Numerical and computational methods are nowadays used in a wide range of contexts in complex systems research, biology, physics, and engineering. Over the last decades different methodological schools have emerged with emphasis on different aspects of computation, such as nature-inspired algorithms, set oriented numerics, probabilistic systems and Monte Carlo methods. Due to the use of different terminologies and emphasis on different aspects of algorithmic performance there is a strong need for a more integrated view and opportunities for cross-fertilization across particular disciplines. [...] Heidelberg : Springer, 2013 e-proceedings

snippet.title: Molecular line emission from a protoplanetary disk irradiated externally by a nearby massive star
snippet.description: Molecular line emission from a protoplanetary disk irradiated externally by a nearby massive star / Walsh, Catherine (Astrophysics Research Centre, School of Mathematics and Physics, Queen's University Belfast, UK ; Leiden Observatory, Leiden University, The Netherlands) ; Millar, T J (Astrophysics Research Centre, School of Mathematics and Physics, Queen's University Belfast, UK) ; Nomura, Hideko (Department of Astronomy, Graduate School of Science, Kyoto University, Japan) Star formation often occurs within or nearby stellar clusters. Irradiation by nearby massive stars can photoevaporate protoplanetary disks around young stars (so-called proplyds) which raises questions regarding the ability of planet formation to take place in these environments. [...] arXiv:1303.4903.- 2013 \- Published in : Walsh, Millar, & Nomura 2013, ApJL, 766, L23 External link: Preprint

Cassiopeia A was observed using the Low-Band Antennas of the LOw Frequency ARray (LOFAR) with high spectral resolution. [...] arXiv:1302.3128. \- 2013\. Preprint

snippet.title: Centenary of the discovery of superconductivity La supraconductivité fête ses 100 ans
snippet.description: Centenary of the discovery of superconductivity La supraconductivité fête ses 100 ans / Anaïs Vernède To mark the centenary of the discovery of the phenomenon of superconductivity, MANEP and the University of Geneva are organising open days at the PhysiScope between 8 and 15 April 2011. On 13 April CERN will make a contribution to the series of events with a lecture on superconductivity followed by a demonstration of the phenomenon at the Globe Historic graph showing the superconducting transition of mercury, measured in Leiden in 1911 by H [...] BUL-NA-2011-091.- 2011 \- Published in : CERN Bulletin 15/2011 16/2011 Fulltext: supraconductivit&eacute_image. \- JPG; supraconductivit&eacute_image.(1) \- JPG; supra_image \- JPG; supra(1)_image \- JPG;
